content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"> <Esri> <CreaDate>20140922</CreaDate> <CreaTime>15201400</CreaTime> <ArcGISFormat>1.0</ArcGISFormat> <SyncOnce>TRUE</SyncOnce> </Esri> <dataIdInfo> <idAbs>Grizzly Or Brown Bear Distribution Model [mbrbex] - Ursus arctos. GAP distribution models represent the areas where species are predicted to occur based on habitat associations. GAP distribution models are the spatial arrangement of environments suitable for occupation by a species. In other words, a species distribution is created using a deductive model to predict areas suitable for occupation within a species range. To represent these suitable environments, GAP compiled existing GAP data, where available, and compiled additional data where needed. Existing data sources were the Southwest Regional Gap Analysis Project (SWReGAP) and the Southeast Gap Analysis Project (SEGAP) as well as a data compiled by Sanborn Solutions and Mason, Bruce and Girard. Habitat associations were based on land cover data of ecological systems and--when applicable for the given taxon--on ancillary variables such as elevation, hydrologic characteristics, human avoidance characteristics, forest edge, ecotone widths, etc. Distribution models were generated using a python script that selects model variables based on literature cited information stored in a wildlife habitat relationship database (WHRdb); literature used includes primary and gray publications. Distribution models are 30 meter raster data and delimited by GAP species ranges. Distribution model data were attributed with information regarding seasonal use based on GAP regional projects (NWGAP, SWReGAP, SEGAP, AKGAP, HIGAP, PRGAP, and USVIGAP), NatureServe data, and IUCN data. A full report documenting the parameters used in the Grizzly Or Brown Bear model can be found at: http://gis1.usgs.gov/csas/gap/viewer/species/ModelReport.ashx?species=mbrbex A web map service for this species' distribution model can be accessed here: http://gis1.usgs.gov/ArcGIS/rest/services/NAT_Species_Mammals/mbrbex/MapServer The species' associated range data can be accessed here: http://gis1.usgs.gov/csas/gap/viewer/species/DownloadData.aspx?species=mBRBEx A table listing all of GAP's available web map services can be found here: http://gapanalysis.usgs.gov/species/data/web-map-services/ GAP used the best information available to create these species distribution models; however GAP seeks to improve and update these data as new information becomes available. Recommended citation: U.S. Geological Survey Gap Analysis Program (USGS-GAP). 2014. National Species Distribution Models. Available: http://gapanalysis.usgs.gov. Accessed [date]. Online references: U.S. Geological Survey Gap Analysis Program: http://gapanalysis.usgs.gov Northwest Gap Analysis Project: http://gap.uidaho.edu Southwest Regional Gap Analysis Project: http://swregap.nmsu.edu/HabitatModels/default.htm Southeast Gap Analysis Project: http://www.basic.ncsu.edu/segap Alaska Gap Analysis Project: http://aknhp.uaa.alaska.edu/zoology/akgap Hawaii Gap Analysis Project: ftp://ftp.gap.uidaho.edu/products/Hawaii.zip Puerto Rico Gap Analysis Project: http://prgap.org U.S. Virgin Islands Gap Analysis Project: http://prgap.org . General metadata may be found at: <a href="http://gapanalysis.usgs.gov/species/data/metadata/">http://gapanalysis.usgs.gov/species/data/metadata/</a> Individual species metadata is available with the download package at: <a href="http://gis1.usgs.gov/csas/gap/viewer/species/DownloadData.aspx">http://gis1.usgs.gov/csas/gap/viewer/species/DownloadData.aspx</a></idAbs> <searchKeys> <keyword>Grizzly Or Brown Bear</keyword> <keyword>Ursus arctos</keyword> <keyword>Species Distribution</keyword> <keyword>Gap Analysis</keyword> <keyword>GAP</keyword> <keyword>Biodiversity</keyword> <keyword>Conservation</keyword> </searchKeys> <idPurp>National Gap Analysis Program Species Models</idPurp> <idCredit>U.S. Geological Survey, Core Science Analytics and Synthesis and Libraries, National Gap Analysis Program</idCredit> <resConst> <Consts> <useLimit/> </Consts> </resConst> <idCitation> <resTitle>Grizzly Or Brown Bear Distribution Model [mbrbex]</resTitle> </idCitation> </dataIdInfo> <Binary> <Thumbnail> <Data EsriPropertyType="PictureX"></Data> </Thumbnail> </Binary> </metadata>
